OpenShift Commons

Where partners, customers, and contributors come together to collaborate and work together using OpenShift.

OpenShift Commons

Commons builds connections and collaboration across OpenShift communities, projects and stakeholders. In doing so we'll enable the success of customers, users, partners, and contributors as we deepen our knowledge and experiences together.


Our goals go beyond code contributions. Commons is a place for companies using OpenShift to accelerate its success and adoption. To do this we'll act as resources for each other, share best practices and provide a forum for peer-to-peer communication.

Find Your Commonality

OpenShift is an inclusive, open and inviting community filled with passionate people. Chances are, there is a local OpenShift event near you already in the works, check out our Events calendar or connect with the OpenShift Accelerators nearest you and organize your own local event.

Become a part of something bigger

OpenShift Commons open to OpenShift users (individuals), enterprises, non-profits, educational institutions, partners, service providers, hosting providers and related open source technology projects that are either utilized under the hood or to extend the platform with services and additional functionality.


  • If you (or your organization) are an OpenShift Online or an OpenShift Enterprise customer or you have deploy OpenShift Origin on premise or on a public cloud, this is the forum for you to connect with your peers.
  • If you have extended OpenShift with your services or contributed to the OpenShift Origin project and want to connect with your peers and those users of your services on OpenShift, this is the forum for you.
  • If you simply want to stay up-to-date on the roadmap and best practices for using, deploying and operating OpenShift, the OpenShift Commons is the right place for you.

Ready to Join?
